segments.text: I'm watching this kitchen scene, and honestly, I'm a bit bothered by it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can someone be so completely out of touch with their surroundings?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That sink has been overflowing for what seems like ages now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is everywhere, dripping down the cabinets, making a large puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And she's just there, polishing a plate, completely unconcerned.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is literally in the water, and she still doesn't react.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Itâ€™s almost irresponsible, this level of distraction.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Meanwhile, those children are engaged in their own risky business.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is practically inviting a fall with that wobbly stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone needs to snap her out of her dish-drying trance.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This kitchen is going to be soaked, and someone is going to get hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I really can't stand to watch such preventable accidents unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The serene garden outside just makes the interior chaos even more grating.
segments.speaker: PAR
